Even if try to change the ominsharp logs level I can not see anything more than the message:   `Downloading package 'Razor Language Server...`

comment.body:
@davidwengier unfortunately I am behind a corporate proxy ibosscloud
I have my Windows PowerShell and PowerShell 7 system profile.ps1 configured with the following:
```powershell
$proxy="http://cn-randomid.ibosscloud.com:80"
$env:HTTP_PROXY=$proxy
$env:HTTPS_PROXY=$proxy
```
Relevant VS Code Settings. Proxy server is the same as in the profile.
```json
{
    "http.proxy": "http://cn-randomid.ibosscloud.com:80",
    "http.proxySupport": "on",
    "http.proxyStrictSSL": false
}
```

I am able to install and uninstall the Extensions from VS Code with no issue. I am also able to access the download link via Edge, so the proxy does allow access.

The zip file was directly extracted into the `.vscode\extensions\ms-dotnettools.csharp-2.8.23-win32-x64\.razortelemetry` directory. I see language folders and and a bunch of dlls. It looks like it is in the correct location.

I do notice that VS code keeps creating an empty `install.Begin` file in `.vscode\extensions\ms-dotnettools.csharp-2.8.23-win32-x64\.razortelemetry` when it starts.

## Steps to reproduce

1. In VsCode, navigate to the extension window and download the C# Dev Kit
2. Create a folder and create a Blazor Web App for Server project in it:
```
mkdir BlazorServer
cd BlazorServer
dotnet new blazor -int Server
```
3. Navigate to the folder you created Blazor Web for Server and open VS Code using Terminal Emulator.
```
code .
```
## Note
1.  This issue does not repro on Linux.
2. This issue also repro when I turned on "**Working With Test Signed Sdk**" on settings.
3. I'm not sure if this issue causing the project without Solution Explorer.

## Active behavior
During downloading the .NET runtime, it will pop up an error dialog: **Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LanguageServer client: couldn't create connection to server.** and the project no Solution Explorer.
![MicrosoftTeams-image](https://github.com/dotnet/vscode-csharp/assets/108645282/3084bebc-f06f-4dbb-bc26-d7ef2d20a822)

## Expected  behavior
There will not have any error dialog pop up and the Solution Explorer of project could load successfully.

comment.body:
I don't think we should have this fallback.  If the platform doesn't exist that we're packaging the vsix for, that is an error in setup authoring.

Fine with having fallbacks at runtime.  But not in creating the vsix.

issue.title: Spurious "There were problems loading project" warnings
issue.body:
Type: Bug When loading a solution that contains C# projects there is often a warning "There were problems loading project" with a link to the logs. The logs show the project loading just fine. **Request** A flag to be able to disable this warning. There used to be with Omnisharp, but we no longer seem to have the option ## Steps to Reproduce ## Open a VSCode window. Or even just trigger a UI refresh. ## Expected Behavior ## No warnings ## Actual Behavior ## Warnings that are unhelpful and incorrect ## Logs ## ### C# log ###
[Info - 12:50:04] [LanguageServerProjectSystem] Successfully completed load of /Users/me/stuff/Server.csproj [Info - 12:50:04] [LanguageServerProjectSystem] Completed (re)load of all projects in 00:00:01.4790723 Failed to find dotnet info from path, falling back to acquire runtime via ms-dotnettools.vscode-dotnet-runtime No compatible .NET runtime found. Minimum required version is 7.0.
server.csproj (a .NET project) was the project that triggered the warning. comment.body:
@ChrisMaunder would you mind setting `dotnet.server.trace` to `Trace` in vscode setings?  Then attach the C# logs here again.  

There is definitely an issue with the 7.0.100 SDK (will have a fix shortly), but that shouldn't cause project load warnings.   Can you also confirm there are no warnings on a normal dotnet CLI build of the project?

This version doesn't exactly match the version above since `23516.2` wasn't published with a platform agnostic language server. This is temporary and should be resolved whenever Razor next updates its versions.
